subject: Fwd: #SSN1814 - issue with pedal box.
description_text:
Hi,

I recently purchased a haptic kit on order #SSN1814.

I have installed everything correctly and have updated the pedal box to cpu
version:2.0.2.

But after a short period of testing, the box now freezes and the motors
continue to shake while no input is being sent to the box. Secondly, the
connection to the usb to the pc then loses connectivity. After power
cycling the box, it connects again.

If you go to the simsonn manager and send a vibration, the unit then
freezes and a power cycle is then required to stop the vibration.

I then did a manual update and returned the unit to the original firmware,
but the same issue is still occurring.

Any help would be appreciated. Thanks.

-- 
Heath Greenland
*0400132481*

conversations.body_text: Hi Heath Greenland,  Please take a screenshot of your current SIMSONN Manager interface so I can confirm whether you're using version 2.0.9. Also, was everything working fine before the update? Did the issue occur only after upgrading to 2.0.9?

Hi,

 I cant confirm if it was working with the older firmware, as soon as I
unboxed, I installed the manager, and installed the latest firmware.

I had downloaded the latest 2.0.9 manager.

I'll send a screenshot and a video later today to show what is happening.

Thanks.
Heath Greenland
*0400132481*

On Thu, 17 July 2025, 9:26 am support@simsonn.com,

Sorry for the delay. Please see the attached images of the software.

See the link for the video of what is happening.

20250719_072656.mp4
<https://1drv.ms/v/c/9a5d4c7b75c4d582/EemJsHTFgCFJhRZxEFBowu0BI7-xGd9OZm7Bjgwzmf0xCg?e=zyqCoX>

Any further information please let me know.

Heath.







Heath Greenland

On Sat, 19 July 2025, 5:39 pm support@simsonn.com,
Hi Heath Greenland,    I’ve submitted a Google access request — please check and approve it when convenient. Thank you!

Hi Heath Greenland,    We noticed you’ve modified the pedals — could you kindly share some high-resolution photos and explain the purpose or idea behind the modification? We’d love to learn from your approach!     Also, to help us troubleshoot the USB disconnection issue, please try the following steps:      Turn off the wheelbase power;  Disconnect all other USB devices, keeping only our pedals, keyboard, and mouse connected;  Do not plug in the motor;  Connect the pedal’s USB and power supply only;  Open the software and click “Test” to check if the USB disconnection still occurs.         This issue seems unusual, and these steps will help us better understand the cause. Thank you for your cooperation!

I have allowed you to view

Heath Greenland
*0400132481*

I have downloaded and have the PC running now.

On Fri, 25 July 2025, 7:09 pm support@simsonn.com,

Hi,

I have received the newest control box and I have now updated the firmware
of the new box.

I have now done some further testing, and I believe that this was miss
diagnosed when I received the support call.

If I use the throttle motor in motor port 1, 2 and 3. I have no issues. The
motor and control box works as intended.
If I use the brake motor in any port, it causes the box to disconnect and
freeze so the brake motor will not stop shaking or it will disconnect from
the computer and restart.

I have tried the first control box again and this is the same for both
boxes.
I have checked both motors for ohms and get 25.4ohms on each.

I am 100% confident that the brake shaker motor is the one causing the
issue, not the control box.

Sorry for the delay in the response, I have been away on vacation and have
not been able to test.

Thanks
Heath

On Fri, Jul 25, 2025 at 7:31 PM Heath Greenland <heath.greenland@gmail.com>

It's all ok. Thanks for working with me on the issue.

Sorry that it's happened the way it's happened.

Heath Greenland
